description: Provides all available details about the instance groups in a cluster.

parameters.name: ClusterId
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster for which to list the instance groups.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroups
nested_items.description: The list of instance groups for the cluster and given filters.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the instance group.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the instance group.

nested_items.name: Market
nested_items.description: The marketplace to provision instances for this group. Valid values are ON_DEMAND or SPOT.

nested_items.name: InstanceGroupType
nested_items.description: The type of the instance group. Valid values are MASTER, CORE or TASK.

nested_items.name: BidPrice
nested_items.description: If specified, indicates that the instance group uses Spot Instances. This is the maximum price you are willing to pay for Spot Instances. Specify OnDemandPrice to set the amount equal to the On-Demand price, or specify an amount in USD.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 instance type for all instances in the instance group.

nested_items.name: RequestedInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The target number of instances for the instance group.

nested_items.name: RunningInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The number of instances currently running in this instance group.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the instance group.

nested_items.name: StateChangeReason
nested_items.description: The status change reason details for the instance group.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The programmable code for the state change reason.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The status change reason description.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The creation date and time of the instance group.

nested_items.name: ReadyDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the instance group became ready to perform tasks.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the instance group terminated.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: The list of configurations supplied for an Amazon EMR cluster instance group. You can specify a separate configuration for each instance group (master, core, and task).

nested_items.name: Classification
nested_items.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_items.name: Properties
nested_items.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConfigurationsVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of the requested configuration specification for this instance group.

nested_items.name: LastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurations
nested_items.description: A list of configurations that were successfully applied for an instance group last time.

nested_items.name: Classification
nested_items.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_items.name: Properties
nested_items.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LastSuccessfullyAppliedConfigurationsVersion
nested_items.description: The version number of a configuration specification that was successfully applied for an instance group last time.

nested_items.name: EbsBlockDevices
nested_items.description: The EBS block devices that are mapped to this instance group.

nested_items.name: VolumeSpecification
nested_items.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, size (GiB) and throughput (MiB/s) that are requested for the EBS volume attached to an Amazon EC2 instance in the cluster.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. Volume types supported are gp3, gp2, io1, st1, sc1, and standard.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: SizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput, in mebibyte per second (MiB/s). This optional parameter can be a number from 125 - 1000 and is valid only for gp3 volumes.

nested_items.name: Device
nested_items.description: The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.

nested_items.name: EbsOptimized
nested_items.description: If the instance group is EBS-optimized. An Amazon EBS-optimized instance uses an optimized configuration stack and provides additional, dedicated capacity for Amazon EBS I/O.

nested_items.name: ShrinkPolicy
nested_items.description: Policy for customizing shrink operations.

nested_items.name: DecommissionTimeout
nested_items.description: The desired timeout for decommissioning an instance. Overrides the default YARN decommissioning timeout.

nested_items.name: InstanceResizePolicy
nested_items.description: Custom policy for requesting termination protection or termination of specific instances when shrinking an instance group.

nested_items.name: InstancesToTerminate
nested_items.description: Specific list of instances to be terminated when shrinking an instance group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstancesToProtect
nested_items.description: Specific list of instances to be protected when shrinking an instance group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceTerminationTimeout
nested_items.description: Decommissioning timeout override for the specific list of instances to be terminated.

nested_items.name: AutoScalingPolicy
nested_items.description: An automatic scaling policy for a core instance group or task instance group in an Amazon EMR cluster. The automatic scaling policy defines how an instance group dynamically adds and terminates Amazon EC2 instances in response to the value of a CloudWatch metric. See PutAutoScalingPolicy.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: Indicates the status of the automatic scaling policy.

nested_items.name: StateChangeReason
nested_items.description: The reason for a change in status.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: The code indicating the reason for the change in status. USER_REQUEST indicates that the scaling policy status was changed by a user. PROVISION_FAILURE indicates that the status change was because the policy failed to provision. CLEANUP_FAILURE indicates an error.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A friendly, more verbose message that accompanies an automatic scaling policy state change.

nested_items.name: Constraints
nested_items.description: The upper and lower Amazon EC2 instance limits for an automatic scaling policy. Automatic scaling activity will not cause an instance group to grow above or below these limits.

nested_items.name: MinCapacity
nested_items.description: The lower boundary of Amazon EC2 instances in an instance group below which scaling activities are not allowed to shrink. Scale-in activities will not terminate instances below this boundary.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: The upper boundary of Amazon EC2 instances in an instance group beyond which scaling activities are not allowed to grow. Scale-out activities will not add instances beyond this boundary.

nested_items.name: Rules
nested_items.description: The scale-in and scale-out rules that comprise the automatic scaling policy.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name used to identify an automatic scaling rule. Rule names must be unique within a scaling policy.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A friendly, more verbose description of the automatic scaling rule.

nested_items.name: Market
nested_items.description: Not available for instance groups. Instance groups use the market type specified for the group.

nested_items.name: SimpleScalingPolicyConfiguration
nested_items.description: The type of adjustment the automatic scaling activity makes when triggered, and the periodicity of the adjustment.

nested_items.name: AdjustmentType
nested_items.description: The way in which Amazon EC2 instances are added (if ScalingAdjustment is a positive number) or terminated (if ScalingAdjustment is a negative number) each time the scaling activity is triggered. CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY is the default. CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY indicates that the Amazon EC2 instance count increments or decrements by ScalingAdjustment, which should be expressed as an integer. PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY indicates the instance count increments or decrements by the percentage specified by ScalingAdjustment, which should be expressed as an integer. For example, 20 indicates an increase in 20% increments of cluster capacity. EXACT_CAPACITY indicates the scaling activity results in an instance group with the number of Amazon EC2 instances specified by ScalingAdjustment, which should be expressed as a positive integer.

nested_items.name: ScalingAdjustment
nested_items.description: The amount by which to scale in or scale out, based on the specified AdjustmentType. A positive value adds to the instance group's Amazon EC2 instance count while a negative number removes instances. If AdjustmentType is set to EXACT_CAPACITY, the number should only be a positive integer. If AdjustmentType is set to PERCENT_CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY, the value should express the percentage as an integer. For example, -20 indicates a decrease in 20% increments of cluster capacity.

nested_items.name: CoolDown
nested_items.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start. The default value is 0.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchAlarmDefinition
nested_items.description: The definition of a CloudWatch metric alarm. When the defined alarm conditions are met along with other trigger parameters, scaling activity begins.

nested_items.name: ComparisonOperator
nested_items.description: Determines how the metric specified by MetricName is compared to the value specified by Threshold.

nested_items.name: EvaluationPeriods
nested_items.description: The number of periods, in five-minute increments, during which the alarm condition must exist before the alarm triggers automatic scaling activity. The default value is 1.

nested_items.name: MetricName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch metric that is watched to determine an alarm condition.

nested_items.name: Namespace
nested_items.description: The namespace for the CloudWatch metric. The default is AWS/ElasticMapReduce.

nested_items.name: Period
nested_items.description: The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied. CloudWatch metrics for Amazon EMR are emitted every five minutes (300 seconds), so if you specify a CloudWatch metric, specify 300.

nested_items.name: Statistic
nested_items.description: The statistic to apply to the metric associated with the alarm. The default is AVERAGE.

nested_items.name: Threshold
nested_items.description: The value against which the specified statistic is compared.

nested_items.name: Unit
nested_items.description: The unit of measure associated with the CloudWatch metric being watched. The value specified for Unit must correspond to the units specified in the CloudWatch metric.

nested_items.name: Dimensions
nested_items.description: A CloudWatch metric dimension.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The dimension name.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The dimension value.

nested_items.name: CustomAmiId
nested_items.description: The custom AMI ID to use for the provisioned instance group.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
